column4: hello, I have installed ubuntu on my entire disk, without partitions. can I format the disk so that I can install windows 7 on it, and then install ubuntu 10.04 alongside with it?
use win7 to resize it to make a free partition space..
you can install win7 after ubuntu, you just need to reinstall grub later on.
if you dont care about the installation you have now then the best thing would be win7 first, then ubuntu......
just resize your partition to make an empty partition for win to use
no need to format it.. just make it free and available
be advised you`ll need to boot a livecd to reinstall grub
you`ll need to run sudo grub-install /dev/sda  from a livecd.. and then boot into ubuntu and run sudo update-grub
then you`ll get windows in the grub menu.
assumiung sda is your hard drive of course.
backup your hd before you mess with it
if your data isnt important that is..
looking at your partition table,  I`d probably install windows first and then ubuntu...if data isnt important.
